CatDescriptText: Phil Meade, Bible salesman, 819 Ridge Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 30, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think single or married women make better teachers for elementary grades in public schools?  Do you think that married men should teach in elementary grades?" answer reads: "I prefer single women in nine out of ten times because this group can concentrate more on teaching elementary school...It's all right for men to teach elementary grades, but I think that the best teachers are those men who are married."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Phil Meade wearing eyeglasses, patterned necktie, and light colored suit jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
